fields.summary: Repeatedly sending customer notifications on requests with invalid request types

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
In the Service Desk reports section, when you have a large number of custom reports, it is currently not possible to group these reports into a nested version which allows a more streamlined method of searching for reports that have been created. 

As it stands, you have to manually search the reports and at times, you have to scroll up and down to gather reports which could potentially be grouped together under one banner. 


*Suggested Solution*

Allow the ability  to nest Service Desk reports, with a label to group these nested reports. This helps in viewing the reports which is easier on the eye, and feels less cluttered. 

*Workaround*

As this is a feature limitation, there are no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: The ability to nest Service Desk Reports into a Group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, KB article that contains image with "center align" format , it will not worked. Due to Center-Macro remove from Confluence (https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html) , the workaround is to use "center align" at Confluence site. However , for image , it remain at left side eventhough it already set to center.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Service Desk project
# Go to Knowledge base space and create a page.
# Type a text and add an image.
# Set it to "center align". Expected as below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-07-17 at 7.37.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Once publish, view it from Customer Portal.

h3. Expected Results
Image at center of the page.

h3. Actual Results
Image not center.
 !Screenshot 2019-07-17 at 7.38.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Knowledge base article image doesn't work with center align from Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Avatars of Jira Service Desk customer accounts were stored in a 3rd-party service Gravatar.
 We cannot use this service any more due to GDPR compliance.

As a result, there are no more custom avatars that were used by service desk customer accounts.
h3. Customer Impact

When agents checks ticket in Jira UI, it is hard to distinguish customers since default avatar has a background colour and shows only initials.
h3. Notes

We are open for suggestions to have avatars for Jira Service Desk customers back and gathering interest.
fields.summary: Avatar support for non-Atlassian Account JSD customers

fields.description:
Hello,

I would like to suggest adding a refresh button within Jira Service Desk classic to refresh the list of tickets in each queue. Today I have to refresh the entire page via the browser to refesh the view to see new tickets.
fields.summary: Refresh Button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you hover your mouse over a customer account the profile card is displayed without the email address of the account.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue where the reporter is a portal only account.
 # Hover the mouse over the reporter.
 # The profile card will be displayed without the email address of the account.

h3. Expected Results

It should display the profile card with the customer email address.

!atlassian account.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The profile card is displayed without the email address.

!portal only.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The e-mail address can be retrieved by looking up the user in the Customer page.
fields.summary: Profile card is not displaying email address for Customer Accounts.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the recent GDPR changes to allow restrictions for profile information:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-968656104.html

These changes impact the visibility of Portal-only users, however, those users have no means by which to allow visibility to the email addresses.
This can cause a great deal of confusion as Service Desk agents cannot know which email address they are replying to or adding as request participants by peeking the user details by hovering over the user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Service Desk portal-only user
# Have that user create an issue
# Open the issue as a non-site-admin service desk agent
# Attempt to determine the email address of the user

h3. Expected Results
Hovering over the user shows the user card with the email address.

h3. Actual Results
The card does not show on hover and in places where it does show does not show the email address of the user.

h3. Notes
The email address does get listed in the "customers" page of the project, however, if the friendly names of two users are identical, it is impossible to tell the two apart in the context of an issue.

h3. Workaround
Currently the closest workaround is to request that your customers set their friendly name to either be their email address, or to be something highly unique.
fields.summary: Portal-only user accounts cannot allow access to view their email addresses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While raising a request, portal-only customer is not able to find themselves in ant user picker field although the sharing permission allows the _Other customers in their organization_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the *Who can customers share requests with?* to _Other customers in their organization_
# Ensure the reporter belongs to an organization
# Raise a request, find the reporter in the Approver field

h3. Expected Results
The approver is found when searched
h3. Actual Results
The approver is not found when searched

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reporter unable to find themselves in user picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk REST API pagination attributes not working as expected
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a call to JSD REST API like:
{quote}
h5. [Get customers|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-serviceDeskId-attachTemporaryFile-post]
{noformat}
GET /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/customer
{noformat}
{quote}
 # Make sure that your instance has multiple customers (1K+)
 # Try to use the parameter:
{noformat}
?start=1000
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
 * We should be able to retrieve the users from that specific position

h3. Actual Results

No users are retrieved.
h3. Notes

Other issues with this endpoint:
 * Even if not specified on the documentation, this is an experimental endpoint. Therefore, you must add the {{X-ExperimentalApi: opt-in}} header in your requests or it won't work.
 * The *_isLastPage_* attribute is returning as true on each request.
 * The *_start_* and _*limit*_  attributes do not reflect the values passed as url parameters.
 For example, callling: [https://XXXX.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/12/customer?start=10&limit=10|https://xxxx.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/12/customer?start=10&limit=10] returns:
{noformat}
{
    "size": 10,
    "start": 0,
    "limit": 50,
    "isLastPage": true,
...
{noformat}

 
h3. Workaround

There are no workarounds available at this time.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk REST API pagination attributes not working as expected

fields.description:
Currently, below a Request Type group name on the portal, all request types associated with that group will be listed.

In cases where you have many groups with many Request Types associated with each group, each group will have its own wall of text below its name containing several lines of text made entirely of Request Types.

It'd be useful to be able to edit that list/text without having to remove the Request Types from the groups.
fields.summary: Add ability to customize what'll appear below a Request Type group on the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Incorrect redirect(routing) at the customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Logging at customer portal with a portal only account
# Access the link from the Jira ticket like:
{noformat}
instaceURL/browse/TEST-123
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Customer is redirected to access the ticket within the customer portal.

h3. Actual Results
User is redirected to the Help Center instead.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround available at this time.
fields.summary: Incorrect redirect(routing) at the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incorrect German translation of the text in the portal:
"Raise this request on behalf of"


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change Jira language to Deutsch
# Go to the service desk portal 


h3. Expected Results
The correct translation should be: "*Anfrage erstellen im Auftrag von"

h3. Actual Results
Translation now is: "Diese Anfrage stellen für."
fields.summary: Incorrect German translation in service desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When internal comment added , webhook post set jsdPublic to true. By right , the jsdPublic equal to false.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable webhook for comment added.
 # Open JIRA Service Desk project issue.
# Add an internal comment

h3. Expected Results
View the webhook post , the jsdPublic set to false.

h3. Actual Results
View the webhook post , the jsdPublic set to true. Refer the example below :-
{noformat}
{
    "timestamp": 1561018411920,
    "webhookEvent": "comment_created",
    "comment": {
        "self": "https://nroslan.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/30901/comment/29038",
        "id": "29038",
        "author": {
            "self": "https://nroslan.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=557057%3A1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "name": "557057:1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "key": "ID14607",
            "accountId": "557057:1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Nur Atiqah Roslan",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "Europe/Lisbon",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
        "body": "Hello internal comment",
        "updateAuthor": {
            "self": "https://nroslan.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=557057%3A1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "name": "557057:1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "key": "ID14607",
            "accountId": "557057:1a8aeee5-40e9-413a-9f4e-2f074f09644a",
            "avatarUrls": {
                "48x48": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=48&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D48%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "24x24": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=24&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D24%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "16x16": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=16&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D16%26noRedirect%3Dtrue",
                "32x32": "https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/f64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3?s=32&d=https%3A%2F%2Fsecure.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Ff64187985b0170ecbde5c51133ecfff3%3Fd%3Dmm%26s%3D32%26noRedirect%3Dtrue"
            },
            "displayName": "Nur Atiqah Roslan",
            "active": true,
            "timeZone": "Europe/Lisbon",
            "accountType": "atlassian"
        },
        "created": "2019-06-20T16:13:31.920+0800",
        "updated": "2019-06-20T16:13:31.920+0800",
        "jsdPublic": true
    },
    "issue": {
        "id": "30901",
        "self": "https://nroslan.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/30901",
        "key": "MAK-197",
{noformat}
 !Screenshot 2019-06-20 at 4.31.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Retrieve again the comment information using {code}/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/comment/{id}{code} REST API request. From the REST API response, the comment visibility return {{"jsdPublic":false}} . More details about the REST API refer to [Get Comment|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-issue-issueIdOrKey-comment-id-get] documentation.
fields.summary: Webhook POST for internal comment added set jsdPublic to true

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

Customer ID is displayed instead of Email address on a User Picker custom field when editing issue
h3. *Steps to replicate*
 # Create a User Picker Custom Field
 # Add field to a Request Type
 # Create new Request and enter the Portal-Only User to the User Picker Custom Field and Create Request.
 # View the Request using Old Issue view and Click Edit Issue

h3. Expected Result

Able to view the Customer by Email
h3. Actual Result

The User Picker Custom field is displaying the user name (which for customer users this looks like UUID/codes {{qm:...)}} instead of the display name/email address.
h3. Workaround

-
fields.summary: User name is displayed on a User Picker custom field when editing issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Queue doesn't list all issue when there's column with long value , for example "Description" field.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple issue (best to create more than 3) with long Description.
 # Create queue with a filter that will list all the new issue created.
 # Add "Description" column to the queue.

h3. Expected Results

All issue listed in the queue.
h3. Actual Results

Not all issue listed.
h3. Workaround

Remove the "Description" column from the queue.
fields.summary: Queue doesn't display all issue when there's column with long value for example "Description" field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Due to the changes made to fix JSDCLOUD-8139, creating linked issues no longer copy the field values from the original issue unless those fields are required in the target project.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow copying field values from original issue to target issue.
h3. Why is it important
While the fields are no always required in the target project for other issues, creating linked issues requires the fields to be copied so that the critical information is passed from one issue to another.
h3. Workaround 
If making the field as mandatory in the target field is not an issue, make it required.
fields.summary: Create linked issues does not copy field values from original issue to target issue

fields.description:
When Jira is not able to retrieve the user information, the notifications are marked as delivered and the notifications are not sent to the customer.

*Notes:*
* Internal notifications are not affected.
fields.summary: Customer notifications are not being triggered due to failed user retrieval information

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When someone hovers the mouse on a customer's name, Jira shows the profile card with a link to their profile (instance.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?accountId=..........), but the customer doesn't have one.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-12 at 16.23.28.png|thumbnail! 

Along with it if you find the customer and clicks on their name, an error is thrown.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-12 at 16.27.37.png|thumbnail! 

Internal users without any application access (customers) also don't have a profile and the same page is thrown.

h3. Suggested resolution

Remove the link to the customer's profile.
fields.summary: Clicking on the customer's profile card doesn't show their information

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a customer replies to a notification email containing an image the same image is included in the reply but cannot be rendered in the old issue view.

h3. Environment
JEPP Mail handler.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer create an issue via email.
# As an agent reply to the customer in Jira and include an image
# As the customer reply to the email received 
# As an agent view the issue including the new reply in the *old issue view* 

h3. Expected Results
The copy of the original image included in the customers reply should render as expected:
 !Screenshot 2019-07-12 at 14.10.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed
{noformat}Unable to embed resource: noname of type application/octet-stream{noformat}
 !Screenshot 2019-07-12 at 14.11.39.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
It seems the root cause of this is the handling of the *mimtype* value in the the *fileattachments* table. Currently due to the copy image in the reply not having a name attributed the mime type is stored in Jira as:
{noformat}image/png; name=noname{noformat}
It seems the lack of file extension in the name parameter is causing Jira to not treat this as an image therefore it is not being flagged as thumbnailable.
I have confirmed this by manually changing the value here to contain a file extension and flagging the record as thumbnailable which resolves the problem but is not a practical solution or workaround.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a customer replies to a notification email containing an image the same image is included in the reply but cannot be rendered in the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Approvals won't work if field context is configured for the custom field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project: ABC
# Create a user picker custom field: 'ABC approvers' 
# Configure the 'ABC approvers' field context to be associated with ABC project only.
# Set an approval step and try to get the approver from 'ABC approvers'.


h3. Expected Results

The field is displayed in the "Get approvers from" drop-down.

h3. Actual Results

The field won't show up.

h3.Workaround
Remove the field context
fields.summary: Custom fields with project context will not appear in the "Get approvers from" dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At symbol '@' in a file name does not render in the comments section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file with '@' on the name e.g. file@test.txt
# Attach the file on the ticket and the comment will be shown with the following markup:
* [^file@test.txt]

h3. Expected Results

It shows a link for to access/download the file.

h3. Actual Results

It shows the [^file@test.txt] only instead of a clickable link.

h3.Workaround

* Edit the file name
* If you are using the New Issue view, access the old view and then download the file from the attachments section.
** To access the old view, append to your URL: *oldIssueView=true* 
** ISNTANCE_URL.atlassian.net/browse/TICKET_NUMBER?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: At symbol '@' in a file name does not render in the comments section

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
Currently, the portals are are displayed in order of popularity and it is not possible to sort them as required by the business.

h3. Suggestion
It would make it more convenient to have the ability to order the sequence of portals in which they appear.
fields.summary: Ability to sort portal ordering

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to add request type to the request type groups in a Next Gen Service Desk project

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk Next Gen Project 
# Navigate to the portal
# Click on customize (on the right side of the portal)  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on Request type group > add group > add request type

h3. Current Result

No request type being added even after adding the group. The list is cleared almost immediately

h3. Expected Result
Request type gets added to the group

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.

h3. Notes

- Found _40_ error code in Network Console.
{code}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"The request type you are trying to view does not exist."}],"reasonKey":"sd.customerview.error.requestTypeNotFound","reasonCode":"404"}
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to add request type to the request type groups in a Next Gen Service Desk project

fields.description:
Hello,

Are there any customer tutorials or short videos we could use to get people at our university more comfortable submitting service requests and searching our knowledge base?

If no, do you know of if any schools using Jira Service Desk have created customer focused videos about Jira Service Desk?

Thank you,
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk customer tutorial or video

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to import a JSON/CSV file to a Service Desk next-gen project.

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk next-gen projects.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service Desk next-gen project;
# Try to import a JSON/CSV file using the external system import.

h3. Expected results

The JSON/CSV is imported.

h3. Actual result

The following error is thrown:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-09 at 11.30.11.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Import on a classic project, then move the tickets to the next-gen project.
* [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-agility-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html].
fields.summary: Unable to import a JSON/CSV file to Service Desk next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing queue with more than 100 issues , it start flickering when user scroll up and down. Affected on Firefox and Chrome browser.

h3. Environment
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Firefox browser , open queue with more than 100 issues.
# Scroll down the queue to bottom and scroll up again.

h3. Expected Results
List of issue displaying smoothly.

h3. Actual Results
The queue flickering

h3.Workaround
Use Safari
fields.summary: Queue flickering at Firefox or Chrome browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Service Desk does not have the ability to add customers who can only view requests as any customer would have access to raise a request once added to a project.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow creating customers who can only view request without the ability to create request
fields.summary: Allow creating customers who can only view request without the ability to create request

fields.description: As a Jira Service Desk administrator, it would be useful to have a direct link from a Jira Service Desk project custom email address to OTKA
fields.summary: Enable OTKA integration directly for setting up a custom Email Requests address for Service Desk projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4436 feature request, now customer needs to add attachment syntax to the Description field in order to display the image at Description field after attached the file at Attachment field. 

However, it will be easier if the customer has an attachment button inside the Description field, similar from JIRA. Attachment syntax will automatically be added to the field. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the attachment button/bar inside the Description field when raising an issue from Customer Portal.

h3. Why this is important
Easier for the customer to add an image to the Description field. Sometimes, customer intends to insert a wrong filename causing the syntax not working.

h3. Workaround 
Add syntax manually :-
{noformat}
!filename.png!
{noformat}
fields.summary: Add Attachment bar/button at Customer Portal Description field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , for JIRA Service Desk report custom date range , the minimum date user can choose for "from date" is 366 days before user's current date. The maximum date user can select for "to date" is user's current date. The minimum date and maximum dates are calculated base on user profile time zone, not browser timezone.

It's limited and it's best if admin can increase the range to more than a year.
h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the date range to more than a year.
h3. Why this is important

Admin need to get statistic from report for more than a year. The current date range is limited.
h3. Workaround

(Optional)


{panel:title=Update - 24th November 2020}
This is being closed as it is a duplicate ticket.
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow more than 366 days (one year) custom date range for JIRA Service Desk report

fields.description:
!image-2019-07-09-16-35-13-614.png|width=568,height=309!

 

*Steps to reproduce:*

 1. Create a servicedesk project and don't link it to a confluence space.

 2. Navigate to the knowledge base for that project, e.g. https://<instance>.atlassian.net/projects/<projectkey>/knowledge.

 

*Expected Results:*

A page that links to the project settings screen for linking a confluence space and setting up the knowledge base.

 

*Actual Results:*

An infinite loading spinner.

 

*Workaround:*

Navigate directly to the project settings page for setting up the knowledge base, e.g. https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/<projectkey>/confluence-kb
fields.summary: Viewing the knowledge base screen for a project without a linked confluence results in an infinite loading spinner

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customer using France / French language , their CSAT ratings not translated properly. "Average" word still remain in english.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set customer profile to French
# Resolved a ticket to trigger the CSAT email.

h3. Expected Results
"Average" translated to "Ni bon, ni mauvais"

h3. Actual Results
"Average" remain in English
 !CSAT.jpg|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: CSAT word for "Average" rating not translated to France / French

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a knowledge base space at a JSD project
# Navigate to Jira Service Desk project and select "Reports" > "Requests deflected"
# In a new tab, access the portal, and navigate to a kb article there
# Click "Yes" at "Did this article help?" 
# Reload 2

h3. Expected Results
The count of "Requests deflected in portal" increases

h3. Actual Results
Nothing changes when reloaded
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Clicking "Yes" at "Did this article help?" doesn't get counted toward "Requests deflected" report

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to configure your Outlook to don't download the external content as stated on the doc that it follows: [Block or unblock automatic picture downloads in email messages|https://support.office.com/en-us/article/block-or-unblock-automatic-picture-downloads-in-email-messages-15e08854-6808-49b1-9a0a-50b81f2d617a]
# Create a test ticket with a customer account
# When you receive the customer notification, reply that email adding an Attachment

h3. Expected Results
* Your attachment will be uploaded successfully.

h3. Actual Results
* You will notice that besides your actual attachment, a blank image it will be appended as well on the ticket named: 
** image001.jpg
** Or the attachment can be shown by the URL of the image with an exclamation mark at the beginning.
* In case you are replying over a thread email which has previous attachments, that it will break the access to those files as well.
fields.summary: Attachments from Outlook are broken when download external content is not allowed on Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments may break when editing them via the description field in the new Jira issue view. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Send an email request to the portal with 2 images and a file. 

 !email.png|thumbnail! 

 - Open the resulting Jira issue. Notice that the attachments are shown in both the comment and description section

 !issue.png|thumbnail! 

 - Edit the description section and remove one of the images and save.
 - Check the comment section.
 
h3. Expected Results

The comment section should reflect the remaining attachments and should still load properly. 

h3. Actual Results

An incorrect reference to the deleted attachment remains and some other attachments will fail to load. 

 !bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

- Open the issue in the old view and remove the reference to the broken links.
fields.summary: Attachments break when editing the description in the new Jira issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On issue screens and portal (request screens) of next gen service desk projects, multi-line text fields type are showing as single line text fields causing confusion to users.

h3. Environment
- Next gen service desk projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a "Multi-line text field" custom field.
# Add it to a screen (e.g. create issue screen).
# Trigger the screen to apper ( e.g. Create issue)
Or 
# Add the field to a request type and view it from the portal

h3. Expected Results
The multi-line custom field should appear as a the following:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Multi-line field appears as single-line text field, however it can support multi-line character limit. This causes confusion for the users filling in the field.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
None at the time
fields.summary: Multi-line text fields type in next gen service desk projects are showing as single line text fields

fields.description:
*Summary*

When raising a request and hitting the "Back" button on the browser and dragging and dropping an image will cause the text "Drop files to attach them to your request" pop up and block any other action after uploading picture. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Open any Request Type and after filling details click on "Send" 
# After the request has been sent, click on the "Back" button of your browser 
# This time, try to drag and drop an image into the ticket, you will get the following: 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Once you reach this point, you won't be able to click on anything and basically you are locked and you cannot continue with creating the request, you will need to refresh the page in order to proceed as normal. 

*Expected Results*

Hitting "Back" button should allow the customer to raise another ticket without any blockers.

*Actual Results*

The customer is unable to proceed with the ticket raising action after dragging and dropping an image. 

*Workaround:*

1. Once you click on "Back", hit the "Refresh" button on your browser, so that dragging and dropping action does not get bugged out.
2. Raise a new ticket by clicking on the "Help Center" breadcrumb and choose the "Request Type" again manually.
fields.summary: "Drop files to attach them to your request" interface blocks screen after uploading image

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While replying to notifications adding attachments using jira@instance.atlassian.net (Jira's global incoming mail handler address), the default automation rule "Comment updates reply status" fails in the "comment is primary action" and the ticket is not transitioned.

Ordinarily the "reply-to" field for a customer notification will cause email replies to go to the Service Desk project's mail handler address (eg: projectkey@instance.atlassian.net) which does not experience this problem. In some cases this does not work:
 * The email is not a Service Desk customer notification, but a Jira email. Then replies will go to the jira@... address.
 * The email client used to reply to a customer notification does not respect the "reply-to" field, instead replying to the "from" address.

h3. Environment

Any Jira Service Desk Cloud project with email requests set up and the default automation rule "Comment updates reply status" enabled. 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a ticket and assign it to an agent.
 # Ensure the ticket is in "Waiting for support" status.
 # Use the *Reply* button adding attachments on the notification (this may happen manually or automatically depending on the email client and your email signature). Then ensure that the "to:" address is filled out to {{jira@yourinstancename.atlassian.com}}, and not the Service Desk project mail handler address.
 # Check if the ticket was transitioned.
 ** Also check the automaton rule audit log for the "Comment updates reply status".

h3. Expected results

The comment is added and the automation rule matches all conditions, transitioning the issue.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-03 at 16.35.01.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result

The comment is added, but the automation rule fails in the "Comment is primary action" condition.
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-03 at 16.33.03.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Any of the following should work alone (you should not need to do all 3):
 # Remove the "Comment is primary action" condition from the automation rules;
 # Reply to notifications without attachments;
 # Reply the notification using the project specific email in the TO field.
fields.summary: Replying to jira@instance.atlassian.net adding attachments cause comments to not be the primary action on automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When selecting the default user to run automation rules, clicking on the user search field would show a "No match found" while not clearing the search automatically. The user cannot be selected as it is the current user but the default behavior is as if no users can be found
h3. Suggested Solution
Clear the search when trying to change the default user
fields.summary: Better exception handler when searching for user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Switch the placement of the buttons "Internal comment" and "Share with customer" depending on which type of comment option is used more. 

h3. Proposed Solution

Allow switching of the placement of the buttons "Internal comment" and "Share with customer" on the comment field
fields.summary: Switch the placement of the buttons "Internal comment" and "Share with customer"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When modifying CSS for Customer Notification Template, "border" and "background" properties and not working as expected.
 If you have a property "background":
{code:java}
{ background: black; height: 50px; overflow: hidden; }
{code}
and you would like to add another property - "border":
{code:java}
{ border: 1em solid black; }
{code}
Colour that is mentioned in "background" parameter doesn't work for "border". Any other colour works just fine.
 So there is a dependency on "background" colour parameter.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Try to edit notification template for a Service Desk project:
 Project Settings -> Customer notifications -> "Edit templates"

2. Add the following to CSS section:
{code:java}
.inner-box 
{ background: black; height: 50px; overflow: hidden; }
.outer-box
{ border: 1em solid black; }

{code}
h3. Expected Results

It is expected that a border of the div with class "outer-box" will be now black colour.
h3. Actual Results
 # Email notifications are broken and Service Desk doesn't send any more notifications.
 # The preview window in Template section doesn't update throwing browser console errors and test emails will not be sent.
 # Parameter "\{ border: 1em solid black; }" is ignored.
 If you change "black" to any other colour, e.g. "red" - CSS works as expected. There will be a red border around notification.

h3. Notes

The above combination of "border" and "background" works just fine in a webpage. Colour is not ignored.

The problem seems to be with including a color shorthand (eg: black, red) in the "border" field when that exact same color shorthand is used elsewhere in the css.
h3. Workarounds
 # Using "border-color" everywhere possible instead of including the color shorthand with "border" prevents the issue from occurring
 # Using a hex code for the colour you require prevents the bug from occurring. (eg: instead of "black" try "#000000")

Either should work alone (you don't need to do both).
fields.summary: Using "border" and "background" in CSS for Notification Templates is not working as expected

fields.description:
Some users (portal-only or Atlassian account) that are members of service desk organizations are not being listed when viewing the org in project > Customers.

This also makes the affected users unable to be selected in user picker fields.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service desk organization (JSD project > Customers > Add organizations);
# Invite customers to the organization (enter organization > Add customers);

h3. Expected results

All organization members will be listed.

h3. Actual result

Not always all members are listed.

h3. Workaround

Contact support mentioning this ticket.
fields.summary: Service Desk organizations don't display all members

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently we are only providing SSO via SAML
* There is a [domain verification process|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html] where the domain admin needs to update the DNS records or host a verification file on the root directory of their website
* This isn't usually possible/viable when supporting users on external domains(domains owned by other people)
* Therefore SSO is not possible to use IdPs such as [Azure B2C|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory-b2c/active-directory-b2c-overview] in Jira Service Desk

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow for an SSO solution that is compatible with IdPs such as Azure B2C
* Allow additional SSO options, e.g. SSO via JWT

h3. Why this is important
* Offer more flexibility regarding customer account sign-in options

h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Customer accounts: Support SSO via other methods and identity providers(IdP) e.g. SSO via JWT

fields.description:
Hello

Please see this conversation:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-questions/How-do-I-get-the-Service-Desk-search-to-return-the-same-value-as/qaq-p/1108892?utm_campaign=&utm_content=post&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm]

Please implement what was done in Server 4.2 to Cloud, to cover:

1) accurate search results

2) more than 3 results

Search functionality is extremely poor right now and causing a bad user experience.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Cloud Search Results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Unable to remove the ${issue.key} variable from the customer email template.  Project settings > Customer notifications > Edit Templates
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-01 at 11.22.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow the removal of the ${issue.key} variable in the email Subject line of the customer notification email template

h3. Why this is important
* Offer more flexibility and customization options
 
h3. Workaround 
* Looking into third-party apps on [marketplace.atlassian.com|https://marketplace.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Customer notification: Email template unable to remove the ${issue.key} variable

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 9 October 2019}
The Create Linked Issue capability is now available in the new issue view. It can be accessed as a link via the "Link issue" button:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-24 at 10.45.46 am.png|thumbnail! 
{panel}

h3. Description
The New issue view for the Service Desk project doesn't have the "Create Linked Issue" button when you click on the ellipsis-h icon.

Switching to the Old Issue view, you can be able to see this button but on the new issue view is appears to be missing.

h3. Suggestion
Since this feature is essential when creating issues within our Project, it would be convenient if this same button is added to the new issue view.
fields.summary: Create Linked Issue button not available on New Issue View

fields.description:
It would be great to have a wider space for the contents in Jira Service Desk, specifically the KB from Confluence linked space, since 600px are not enough to show in a proper way the contents.

As for the Confluence spaces, the responsiveness would be necessary.
fields.summary: Wider content space for contents & responsiveness

fields.description:
The date picker in the *Date Needed* field of the Customer Portal allows dates prior to today to be chosen. This doesn't make sense; only the current and future dates should be allowed.
 !2019-06-27_10-49-30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Prevent dates before today from being selected in the Portal's date picker

fields.description:
When creating a request, the reporter should have the option to set the entire organization as watcher when selecting to share the request with the organization.

This would allow Service Desk team to receive customer response more quickly on comments in cases where the customer has a well-established, team based operation.

Currently, members of the organization have to explicitly add themselves as watchers in order to receive notifications. Also, the Service Desk team has to mention other members of the organization individually in the comments if it wants to reach out to anyone other than the reporter even though the ticket is shared.
fields.summary: Option to set organization as watcher when creating requests that are shared with organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Knowledge base managers want to review articles to keep them up to date.

h3. Suggested solution

Allow an expiry date to be set for knowledge base articles. Upon expiry, notify admins or the article author that they should review the article.
fields.summary: Set expiry date on knowledge base articles to prompt review

fields.description: Allow users to filter/sort search results by date created, last modified, author.
fields.summary: Additional filters in agent knowledge base search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Cancel" button translated to "Abbbrechen" instead of "Abbrechen". It have extra *b* letter. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change profile language to Deutsch from Customer Portal
# Create issue from the Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results
Check on the "Cancel" button at bottom of the page , it translated to "Abbbrechen":-
 !Screenshot 2019-06-25 at 8.31.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It should be "Abbrechen"

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Word "Cancel" are wrongly translated in German Language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , when creating a new JIRA Service Desk project , it will automatically create a Confluence space when the instance have Confluence application installed. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Options to create or not to create the space.

h3. Why this is important
Sometimes the JIRA Service Desk not required to have a knowledge base , so creating a space is not required.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Options to disable auto creating Confluence space with creating JIRA Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
Page keeps loading when a Jira administrator with no permission to a next-gen project tries to view service desk specific features.
  !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With *Administer Jira* global permission on your instance, create a private next-gen service desk project and do not add yourself to any role in the People section
# Navigate to the Project > Project settings 
# Try to view JSD specific features like Customer notifications, Channels > Customer Permissions, Email, Widget, Customer portal

h3. Expected Results
An error message to suggest that you do not have permission to view this. 

h3. Actual Results 
The page keeps loading without any error message. In developer console 404 response is received:
Request URL: https://skahol.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/NTRNLSDNXT/settings/requestsecurity?_=1561443963365
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 404
{quote}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Project was not found"}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.servicedesk.error.missingproject","reasonCode":"404"}
{quote}

h3. Notes
Error is reported correctly when you try to view a few SD features like Project settings > *Automation*
 !automation.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Page keeps loading when a Jira administrator with no permission to a private next-gen project tries to view service desk specific features.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Current logic in Jira Service Desk doesn't allow us to control Service Desk customer on a per-project level.
 There is no way to delete a customer from project A and keep this same customer in project B.

Scenario:
 There are 2 projects that are maintained by 2 different Service Desk administrators.
 Administrator of project A wants to block access to their portal for user A, however this same user is still interacting in project B.

The only way for now is to remove service desk customer - on a user management level, accessing <Cloud_instance>/admin, however this removes customer on a Jira level and removes their access to project B as well.
h3. Expected Results

Service Desk administrator should be able to remove a service desk customer from their project and that shouldn't affect other projects.
fields.summary: Ability to remove Service Desk customer on a project level

fields.description:
*+Steps to reproduce:+*
 # Go to project settings -> details -> set project lead and select project lead as default assignee.
 # Navigate to the project > Project Settings > Automation -> Add rule -> Urgent issue alert
 # Now click on the cog symbol on top of Urgent issue alert page to see the options. Under Run rule as it will show Project default and the name of project lead ion brackets.
 # Go back to project settings again and change the project lead.
 # Come back to automation rules, Urgent issue alert will still show the old project lead name under the run rule as option.

 

+*Expected Behaviour:*+

New project lead name should appear under the Run rule as option in Urgent issue alert automation rule.
fields.summary: Changing project default in project settings is not updating the project default value in automation rule.

fields.description: We would like to have ability to control captcha in Customer Portal: turn on and off when needed and also force all customer to use it if needed.
fields.summary: Provide ability to turn captcha on and off in Customer Portal
Entering a custom time in the time picker on the Customer Portal doesn't work

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

As it stands, only Service Desk Agents(user's with Jira Service Desk license) have the ability to raise ticket's on behalf of Service Desk customer. While this is expected, due to the Service Desk related features are linked to the Service Desk license, in scenarios where the Jira user that wants to raise a ticket on behalf of a user is limited.

*Use Case:*

If the user has a Sales Team, that receives emails from customers to raise ticket on their behalf, the Sales Team has to get into contact with the Service Desk agent in order to raise a ticket on their behalf. 

This adds another layer of action instead of the Sales Team being able to raise the ticket's directly. Not to mention, this requires the Sales Team to have a Service Desk license to perform this tasks.

*Request*

It would be great if the minimum requirement to raise a ticket via support portal can be done by a Jira User and not necessarily a Jira Service Desk user. As long as the user belongs to the instance and is given project access.
fields.summary: Ability to Allow other Jira Licensed users to "Raise On Behalf" customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

File drag and drop in the customer portal sometimes freeze the screen, only being possible to exit by refreshing the page, which makes the customer lose all inputs entered in the request fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Customer Portal.
 # Select a Request type that contains the Attachments field.
 # Drag a file from your computer and drop anywhere.
 !print2.png|thumbnail!
 # Observe that the file is successfully attached to the ticket but the screen gets blocked, not being possible to edit fields or submit the request.
 !print.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The file is uploaded successfully and the page doesn't freeze.

h3. Actual Results
The file is uploaded successfully and the page freeze.

h3. Notes

_Dated: 21/Jun/2019 2:06 PM_

The CSS element {{*.cp-portal-dropzone.dropzone-active*}} is what blocks the screen.
Unticking the *visibility* checkbox in Chrome DevTools unblocks the screen, solving the error.

!print3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Attachment drag and drop in Customer Portal freezes screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , when the JSD project is not open to public , meaning only "Customers my team adds to the project" will able to create issue via email and portal. The problem is , when an external customer that's not being added to the project send an email to JSD , their email being rejected with "Signup is not currently available". The agents will not know about it , unless they checked the logs.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to enable notification to agents when customer unable to create issue due to "Signup is not currently available". The agents can proactively add them to the project if it needed.

h3. Why this is important
A better experience for their external customer. If not , their request will be ignored.

h3. Workaround 
Need to monitor the email request logs.
fields.summary: Option to enable notification to agents when customer unable to create issue due to "Signup is not currently available"

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While using a next-gen project, it isn't possible to set a transition to show in the customer portal for customers to transition issues, like Escalate.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add the ability to show transitions in the customer portal for next-gen/team-managed projects.
fields.summary: Add the "Show transition in the customer portal" checkbox for next-gen/team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , the search bar contains the text "Find help and services" and it is not possible to rename it

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customizing the text for branding purposes.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the search bar text
Email requests setting doesn't accept hyphen(dash) '-' in email address for Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
Currently, Jira Service Desk Knowledge base only allows for a global level management of categories. Articles that are related to a main subject either get lost inside the bigger category or end up with their own category thrown in.

h3. Suggested solution
As an admin of Jira Service Desk, I would like to be able to create subcategories for already existing categories in the Knowledge Base. 
For example:
Category: Cars
Subcategories: Engines, Tires, Windshields

More often than not, categories do have more detailed information within them that the current tooling does not allow for better management. 
The example above allows me to have a category for cars as a whole and then, dedicate subcategories for car related articles in more detail.
fields.summary: Ability to create subcategories in Jira Service Desk Knowledge base categories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you access an issue directly typing the URL using *Internet Explorer*, some icons are not being displayed in the Old View.

[https://thetest.atlassian.net/browse/IH-39]

We recorded the following video while we were reproducing the issue.

* [Icon_not_loading.gif|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/356278/IE_Issue.gif]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue using the direct link using Internet Explorer.
 # Check the issue after it's loaded the icons will not be displayed.

h3. Expected Results

It should display the icons of tickets as it does in other browsers or accessing the issue through Jira. You can check the icons working down below.

!working.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

When you access the Jira typing the URL the icons will not be rendered as you can check at the following image.

!not working.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

You could use a different browser as a workaround for this situation.

 

h3. *Notes*

In our tests, we used the *11.706* IE version.
 !IE version.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Icons are not being displayed in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
When using some screen readers (Jaws or NVDA) to interpret the Jira Service Desk Help Center, the search bar field lose focus when a user tries to interact with it, making it possible to select the search bar but not possible to enter text into it.

!Screen Shot 2019-06-18 at 10.50.09.png|thumbnail!

 

It works using the browser extension ChromeVox, so it should also work with other screen readers.
fields.summary: Improve the accessibility of the Help Center when using a screen reader

fields.description:
# The portal should abide by the rules set under customer notifications
 # Ability to edit portal automatic response settings
fields.summary: Allow approvals to work via email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JIRA currently allows all type file upload as attachment and currently cannot restrict attachments to certain file types.
fields.summary: Whitelist and Blacklist attachment type in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the SLA is displayed on filters, the values does not have any background color when the SLA is almost breached or breached unlike the behavior seen in queues
h3. Suggested Solution
Display the SLA with red background if the request has breached or yellow when it is nearly breached.
fields.summary: Display the SLA values with background color in filters

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Viewing customer notification emails in gmail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a request via the portal using an account where the email address is managed by gmail.
 # Wait for the default "We've recieved your request" customer notification in gmail. 

h3. Expected Results

Customer notification emails should have a "View Request" [viewAction|https://developers.google.com/gmail/markup/reference/go-to-action] in gmail. 
h3. Actual Results

Emails do not show the action in gmail.

The action specification tag that Service Desk automatically includes in customer notifications seems to be broken. This broken tag also prevents Service Desk admins from specifying their own action tag in the customer notification HTML customisation, so there doesn't seem to be a workaround.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Gmail inline action for customer notifications is not showing up
Next-gen workflows cannot be saved after changing the default language of the instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, an organization is only meant for one project.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great there's an option to share the organization for another project. 

h3. Why this is important
Easier for administrator to share the customer for other project.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to share Organization for other project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When adding a custom email address to a Jira Service Desk(JSD) project as per [receiving requests by email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html#Receivingrequestsbyemail-Addanemailaccount] and the host portion of the email address matches the local part (the part of the email address to the left of the @ symbol i.e. for name@example.tld, the local part is "name") of the Cloud email address" of another project, you'll get a message to the effect of:
{noformat}
The email address you entered is currently used by the '<project_name>' service desk. 
Check out our troubleshooting docs for help resolving the issue.
{noformat}

Example:
||"ITSM" Project||"DA" Project||
|!Screen Shot 2019-06-17 at 14.20.21.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2019-06-17 at 14.20.15.png|thumbnail!|
|" "|!Screen Shot 2019-06-17 at 14.21.06.png|thumbnail!|

*Please note that the email address used in our example doesn't actually exist, so the authentication step had failed, but the email address has passed validation - which is the most important step for demonstration purposes.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Project A: Navigate to Project settings > Email requests and check the "Cloud email address", e.g. [support@dn-instance.atlassian.net.|mailto:support@dn-instance.atlassian.net].  Take note of this email address.
 # Project B: Navigate to Project settings > Email requests
 # Click "Add a custom email address"
 # Enter the email address "support@dn-domain-name.tld"
 # Enter the remaining details and try to go to the next screen

h3. Expected Results
 * You're presented with the next screen where a request type needs to be selected

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
The email address you entered is currently used by the '<project_name>' service desk. Check out our troubleshooting docs for help resolving the issue.
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * In reference to the example in the "Steps to Reproduce" section, if the custom email address were "suppor@dn-domain-name.tld" - that'd work
 * HTTP request response is 400 with this message:
{noformat}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"The email address you entered is currently used by the '<project_name>' service desk."}],"reasonKey":"sd.email.handler.uniqueName.error","reasonCode":"400"}
{noformat}

 * If the host portions on both the "Custom email address" and "Cloud email address" within the same project, then the validator will pass

h3. Workaround
 * Make sure that the "Cloud email address" on other JSD projects don't share the same local part of the email address as the custom email address you're attempting to add to the project.
fields.summary: Unable to pass validator when setting "Custom email address" if the local part of the custom email address matches the local part of the "Cloud email address" on another project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For instance that using English language while the first project that created the fields were in German language, the "Request Participant", "Approvers" and "Organization" fields are not translated in issue view.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project while selecting German as your default language.
# Set profile language to English
# Open any JIRA Service Desk ticket.

h3. Expected Results
"Request Participant" and "Organization" field translated to English
h3. Actual Results
"Request Participant" and "Organization" field is not translated. It remains as 'Anfrageteilnehmer' and 'Organisationen'

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: "Organization", "Approvers" and "Request Participant" are not translated preferred language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have an action on the Automation rule to create an issue, if you set the Default Assignee to *Unassigned* and save the changes, it will return to *Automatic* when you access the action again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule and set an action to *Create Issue*.
 # Change the default assignee to *Unassigned* and *save* the changes.
 # Access the action again and the default assignee will be *Automatic*.

You can check this behavior at the following link.

[^automation.mov]
h3. Expected Results

It should keep the *Unassigned* option.
h3. Actual Results

It changes the value to *Automatic*.
fields.summary: Default assignee changes back to automatic if you choose unassigned in the automation rule.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When configuring an approval workflow you can choose the "accepted" and "declined" transition, but if another approver is required, only in certain cases, you can't configure a "fork" on depending that condition.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to create a "fork" on the workflow to, depending on a condition, the workflow follows different paths.
fields.summary: Approval workflow "fork"
PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS on adding internal comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Sometimes, there is a need to have multiple SLA goals configured to cover requirements such as priority, customer, timezone
* There is an SLA goal limit that applies per project which limits flexibility and the ability to accommodate for growth

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow the start/pause/stop conditions to include JQL queries
* Find a way to remove the SLA goal limit

h3. Why this is important
* Due to the current SLA goal limitations, it can be difficult to cover all SLA requirements considering the 30 goal limit
 
h3. Workaround 
* Split projects into multiple projects, i.e. single project per customer
fields.summary: SLA: Support JQL queries in the start/pause/stop SLA conditions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to login from the Knowledge base page.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a knowledge base page using incognito browser , for example [https://nroslan.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/7176331]
 # Then , try to login to open the page by clicking *Log In* under "No Access" error . As per screenshot below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-06-12 at 7.42.51 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Go to Customer Portal login page because the link show [https://nroslan.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals]
h3. Actual Results

Get error message as below :-
 !Screenshot 2019-06-12 at 7.45.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page. The login page will display :-
 !Screenshot 2019-06-12 at 7.44.55 PM.png|thumbnail!

or
Click on the log in button on the top-right corner of the screen.
fields.summary: Failed login page from Knowledge Based page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The SLA goal report no only contains the SLA value met/breached and the percentage, it also contains the definition for each SLA which Service Desk agents can refer to when communicating with their customers. It is not possible to recreate the report using the available report
h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back the SLA goal report
fields.summary: Bring back the SLA goal report

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you're uploading a new attachment using the Clip Icon in the New Issue View for Service Desk the system is returning the following error when you're trying to save the comment.

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

{quote}*We couldn't save your comment*
It might be empty or have invalid formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the formatting and adding it directly in the editor.{quote}

In the Devtools, we could find this *400 error*.
{code}{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"comment":"Comment body is not valid!"}}{code}

Also, this problem is just happening when you're trying to add a new attachment, in case you choose one that was already uploaded, you'll not face the problem. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access one Service Desk issue using the New Issue View.
# Click on the *Clip Icon* to add an attachment.
# Upload a new file and Insert it.
# Click to *Save* the comment.

You can check the full video down below.

* [^error.mov]

h3. Expected Results

The comment should be saved and the attachment added into the ticket.

h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to save the comment and add the attachment.

h3.Workaround

As a workaround, it's possible to add the attachment using the *Add internal note* and *Reply to customer* options instead of the *Clip Icon*. You can check this procedure at the following video.

* [^workaround.mov]
fields.summary: Attachment is not being added in the New Issue View for Service Desk.

fields.description:
Hello, I have had a customer request permission to see our knowledge bank, they have access to our Jira service desk to raise or report issues and bugs, but they cannot access our knowledge base. 

We have a situation where some customers have access, while others do not for some reason.  There does not appear to be any difference between customers in the way we have set them up here, yet clearly some do not have the permissions required.

Is this a confluence issue?  If so could you pass this ticket through to the relevant board please.

Below is the request in their own words (redacted).

Thank you.

 

_"How do I get access to the knowledge base_

_It says that xxxxxxxxx@yyyyyyyyyy does not have access to mutualision.atlassian.net_

_Might stop me asking daft questions._

_Many thanks"_
fields.summary: How can a customer see our knowledge bank

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When previously a customer is an existing JIRA user , they will have internal comment added. It will be great there's an option to automatically convert all comment added by the user to public comment when they changed from a JIRA user to a customer account (portal only customer).

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great there's an option to automatically convert all comment added by the user to public comment when they changed from a JIRA user to a customer account (portal only customer).

h3. Why this is important
Customer able to view comment added by himself previously.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Automatically convert existing internal comment to public comment when existing JIRA user changed to Customer account

fields.description:
When logging into my organization's Jira dashboard with brave for first time using the brave browser, the default action of the brave shield is to block that redirect. I disabled both the google sign on site as well as the id.Atlassian site to be able to login.

 

Please contact the brave browser team to update their rules to allow the redirects without requiring user intervention.
fields.summary: Brave Shield Blocks Google Login Redirect

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to a Next-Gen project settings > Channel > Customer portal;
# On the *Logo* section, check the "Use a custom logo for this Customer Portal" option
# Click "Choose logo" and select an image to use as the portal logo
# Click "Save logo"

*Expected Results*
The logo is save and will be used on the portal

*Actual Results*
The following error is shown:
* "Customer Portal logo settings could not be saved"

*Workaround*
None.
fields.summary: Can't add portal logo to Jira Service Desk Next-Gen project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
All attachments added by agents in next-gen service desk project tickets are failing to load for customers in the portal.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue on a Next-Gen Service Desk project.
# As a Service Desk agent, edit the issue description or add a comment including an image attachment.
# As a Customer, open the ticket on the portal.

h3. Expected Results
All images are viewable. 
 !Screenshot 2019-06-07 at 14.14.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Only image uploaded by the customer are viewable.
 !Screenshot 2019-06-07 at 14.15.03.png|thumbnail! 
All images uploaded by agents show this error in the dev console
{color:red}Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page.
{color}


h3.Workaround
No workaround is available at this time.
fields.summary: 403 error when viewing attachments as a Customer for Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
Currently, when a customer is creating an issue through the portal, the only way to get the customer field is when the user uses the share with the organization field.

There should be a functionality to add the organization field independent of the "share with organization" field.  

Absences of this customer organization result in SLA being wrongly calculated when used.
fields.summary: Add organization field independent of the "share with organization" field

fields.description: Is there any plugin where users can use subscriptions  (Status board subscription).
fields.summary: Status board subscription

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, JSD Next-Gen projects do not have the ability to add rules (similar to JSW) to:
# Assign an issue to someone
# Update an issue field
 !2019-06-06_10-54-49.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Add these rules for JSD Next-Gen
fields.summary: Have rules for Next_Gen projects to Assign issues and update issue fields

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Summary

In help desk, once a user deletes an attachment, it's unable to upload the same attachment file until selecting another file.
h3. Environment
 * Windows 10
 * Google Chrome v74

!Screenshot 2019-06-03 14.27.43.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2019-06-03 14.38.37.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a portal
 # Attach a file
 # Cancel the attached file once
 # Attach the same file again and check it doesn't work

Evidence: [*video*|https://youtu.be/HgimX6w9eIU]
h3. Expected Results

Able to upload a file after the cancel.
h3. Actual Results

Portal users cannot upload the same file after the cancellation with a particular environment.
h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email. Until then,
 * Use [Firefox|https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/] instead of Chrome
 * Attaching another file makes you able to upload the attachment file again
fields.summary: Uploading the same attachment after its deletion doesn't work at the help desk with Chrome on Windows 10

fields.description: It would be useful to have the ability to re-order workflow transitions in Next-gen projects. Similar to what we have for classic projects. In classic projects, we can do this using transition property "opsbar-sequence": https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Workflow+properties
fields.summary: Reorder workflow transitions in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When adding a column with a text type custom field to a queue, it cannot be sorted on the fly as other field types.
See Gif: https://cl.ly/cad6a3bfd312

h3. Suggested resolution
Ability to sort on the fly for text type custom fields.
fields.summary: Text type custom fields are not sortable on queues

fields.description:
Currently,  in the SLA  automation,  all we can do in the Alert action is to add named users.   It would be very usefull to have a variable to indicate the current assignee or the reporter.

If I choose email action,  it is a little better as I can chose the reporter,  but still not the assignee.

I wished to be able to notify assignees we there're about to overshoot the SLA.
fields.summary: In JSD automation, provide a value to alert current assignee

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JSD project A, set the customer permission as "Who can access the portal and send requests to <project key>?": "Customers my team adds to the project"
# Confirm that the project has no customers added
# Edit the permission scheme to add "Browse Project" permission to "Reporter"
# Access the portal by a customer that has access to customer portal(customer that is added to another project B)

h3. Expected Results
Customer will only see project B

h3. Actual Results
Customer sees both project  A and B 

h3.Workaround
Remove "Reporter" from "Browse Project" permission
fields.summary: "Browse Project" permission set for Reporter overrides the customer permission that results the project getting exposed in the customer portal

fields.description:
Navigate to a CSAT feedback page with an invalid value, say issue key. For example: https://sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/32/AH-999999999999/feedback?token=f19150d5e5dafc8a7a3e09b2483de45ec15be375&rating=4.

Notice that the error screen is shown, as expected:
 !screenshot-sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net-2019.05.28-14-25-01.png|thumbnail! 

From this error screen, open another page, for example my requests:
 !screenshot-sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net-2019.05.28-14-25-43.png|thumbnail! 

Notice that the my requests page opens, except the error message is still displayed:
 !screenshot-sd-flux-capacitors.atlassian.net-2019.05.28-14-26-20.png|thumbnail! 

My requests should be displayed, not an error page. Also, when navigating to other pages, the error message is still displayed.

Refreshing the page (forcing a full page refresh) fixes the issue.
fields.summary: Navigating from CSAT error page to another page still shows CSAT error page

fields.description:
Can we change the “Search”–button properties  in the MyOrders main-page ?
-	Like a filtering (search only if price > 200 euros) or hide the “Search” -button of main-page view ?

… or can we make javascript in the peripherals  “shared processes” in the script-js  for onSubmit-methods…something like : “if system.order.cost < 200 ..alert “do not order…” return false”  ?
fields.summary: the MyOrders - Main-page...?

fields.description: As a Jira Administrator, for some request types, it'd be best to hide and set a default value for the Summary, Description, and/or assignee fields, however, that is currently not possible in Next-Gen projects.
fields.summary: Add ability to hide and set default value for Summary, Description, and assignee fields on Request Types for Service Desk Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
*Summary*
While logged off from the JSD portal, when a customer clicks on an attachment link from a customer notification, they're prompted to authenticate in order to download the attachment. After entering their credentials, to the login page will freeze in a spinning wheel, even after the download is started/completed.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Add a comment with an attachment as an Agent
# As a customer (not logged in) click on that attachment name from within the customer notification
# You'll be redirected to the portal
# Log in

*Expected Results*
* The file starts to download
* You're either redirected to the request *OR* the tab closes itself

*Actual Results*
* The file starts to download
* You're stuck in the spinning loading animation on the login page
* *Reloading the page will throw an Error 404*

*Notes*

Video where the bug is replicated: https://cl.ly/be4b9a07303a

*Workaround*
Leave the page and access the instance's Help Center at https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk
fields.summary: Logging in on the portal to download an attachment freezes on the "loading" animation

fields.description:
Currently, when wanting to see all entries under the Activity tab, one has to click 'Show more' multiple times. This clicking can add up to many times in case of many entries.

Please make a 'Show all' option available to show all entries with a single click.
fields.summary: Allow all entries in Activity to be shown at once
